oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of two soldiers of the lst Tennessee Regiment, Spanish-American War, 1898
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of two soldiers of the First Tennessee Regiment, mustered into service at Nashville, Tennessee on 26 May 1898. The regiment trained at Camp Merritt, San Francisco, before being sent to the Philippine Islands. The First Tennessee was mustered out in San Francisco, 22 November 1901, and was one of the most honored volunteer regiments and the last to leave United States service. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : sepia ; 4 x 5.5 in., mounted on cardboard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee Infantry. 1st Regiment, 1898-99
Military History; Spanish-American War, 1898--Tennessee--Nashville; Spanish-American War, 1898--Campaigns--Philippines; Soldiers
